name: ostentatiously
content:

in a way that is very obvious and is an attempt to make people notice you, especially to notice your money or expensive possessions: The room was ostentatiously decorated in white and silver. He took out his gold watch and laid it ostentatiously on the table in front of him. See
ostentatious
More examplesFewer examples He spent his money foolishly and ostentatiously.The Hills lived well, but not ostentatiously.She rolled her eyes and sighed ostentatiously.
